description: From German Fahrenheit, named after Prussian scientist Daniel Gabriel Fahrenheit.

entries.meaning: Describing a temperature scale originally defined as having 0째F as the lowest temperature obtainable with a mixture of ice and salt, and 96째F as the temperature of the human body, and now defined with 32째F equal to 0째C, and each degree Fahrenheit equal to 5/9 of a degree Celsius or 5/9 kelvin.
